definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: When the war ended, he was sent to a re-education camp.
sentences.chinese: 當戰爭結束，他被送到了勞改營。

sentences.english: The Xiangride Prison Farm south of Dulan at one time had 100,000 prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 都蘭南部的香日德勞改營曾一度關有囚犯十萬人。

sentences.english: Each city and province maintains its own camp.
sentences.chinese: 各省市都有自己的勞改營地。

sentences.english: His wife, Anna Larina, was sent to a labor camp , but survived.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子被關入勞改營，但是倖存。

sentences.english: Each city and province maintains its own camp .
sentences.chinese: 各省市都有自己的勞改營地。

sentences.english: We feared that at any moment we could be sent to a hard labour camp.
sentences.chinese: 我們害怕不知道什麼時候就會被送去勞改營。
